channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023110358
item.description:
Report X-2023110358

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was found during sort operations at the MEMH. The fiberboard box contained seven glass bottles packaged with bubble wrap for dunnage. One of the seven bottles inside was broken spilling it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023110238
item.description:
Report X-2023110238

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of released was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained a plastic bucket with a removeable top with paper as dunnage. the lid of the bucket opened and spilled it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023110003

Report X-2023110003

  • City: MEMPHIS

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with a puncture hole on the side was found in the MEMH dangerous goods building. The fiberboard box contained four plastic bottles and one of them had been punctured and spilled its contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023111136
item.description:
Report X-2023111136

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was loaded on its side in the delivery van. When driver noticed it was leaking, they fixed the orientation. DescribePack: Package was loaded on its side, causing liquid to leak out of one of the loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the driver realized the package was on its side they fixed the orientation.

item.title: Report X-2023110641
item.description:
Report X-2023110641

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon the discovery of the package, it was promptly secured within a hazardous plastic bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage. The tote was then transferred to the QA HazMat cage for further examination. DescribePack: Three of the 1-gallon bottles had their caps loosened that resulted in a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023110634
item.description:
Report X-2023110634

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-29
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box found on HMPA staging pallet. SDS requested from shipper's local and corporate offices. DescribePack: At least one of four 1 gallon plastic bottles of Veolia L255.4000 Sodium hydroxide solution 1N lost 0.1 gal of fluid due to inadequate preparation for transport. Despite paper dunnage sitting atop bottles and thin plastic bag enclosing bottles, cap closures failed to contain content and bottles were discovered consistently soaked with fluid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned; SDS consulted and ventilation ready if needed.

item.title: Report X-2023110604
item.description:
Report X-2023110604

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-28
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box containing declared fully regulated hazmat found leaking on discharge chute from mezzanine. Transported from operations posthaste. DescribePack: Pinhole puncture to sidewall of container (not following seam) resulted in loss of 2 tablespoons fluid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, hazbag lined tote used to transport leakage to HMPA.

item.title: Report X-2023110596
item.description:
Report X-2023110596

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in unload wet from leaking jugs of liquid. QA stated they cleaned up what little spilled with quick dry and placed the damaged package in a spill kit. This was taken to the HAZMAT cage to isolate and await processing. DescribePack: Damage was identified as coming from lids of 2 of the bottles were they were loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a spill kit and taken to HAZMAT cage to isolate and await processing

item.title: Report X-2023110586
item.description:
Report X-2023110586

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-28
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Haz pkg found on APA chute. Upon inspection it appeared the cap on the inner container was loose, coupled with being sent on the overhead and not orientated correctly caused the internal leakage. DescribePack: Cap was loose/leaking. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: QA identified leaking HAZ pkg and used appropriate materials and procedures to mitigate release.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The stained package was removed from sort, placed in a lined tote, and brought to the QA area. No other information is available. DescribePack: One of the six bottles in the carton leaked at the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined tote and brought to the QA area for processing. The spillage was minor and confined to the carton.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unable to determine sequence of events due to lack of communication with previous shift where the incident occurred. DescribePack: A pinhole on the bottom of one of the bottles caused it to leak approximately a quarter of its contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged package was moved to a QA station away from the other workers.

item.title: Report X-2023110216
item.description:
Report X-2023110216

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The Shipment is 1 of 3 boxes (Master TRK# 606922896068) was leaking, and all contents were placed in a steel salvage package. The box contained a smaller box and small air pouch/cushions. The smaller box contained 10 bottles. Each bottle was individually enclosed in a bubble wrap pouch. 1 of the 10 bottles shattered and lost the entirety of its contents. The remaining 9 bottles were intact. Contact Shipper for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023110007
item.description:
Report X-2023110007

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Oct 24th during the Pm sort the station found a package containing UN2319, Terpene Hydrocarbons, N.O.S.(), 3, III. There were 3 glass bottles of the chemical, and one of the bottles broke open allowing the contents to escape. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and the shipper was asked for an amended shippers declaration in order to move on to the consignee.

item.title: Report X-2023110518
item.description:
Report X-2023110518

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking pail was removed from sort, placed in a plastic-lined tote, and brought to the HWPA for processing. No other information is known. DescribePack: The pail leaked at the cap. It doesn't appear to be vented or loose, so possibly a seal failed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Since the cap is on the top of the pail, spillage was minor and mostly confined to the lid.

item.title: Report X-2023110512
item.description:
Report X-2023110512

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was removed from sort, placed in a lined tote, and brought to the QA area. No other information is known. DescribePack: The bottom corner of the plastic jug is dented and has a small puncture hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The leaking package was placed in a lined tote with an absorbent pad and brought to the QA area. Most spillage was contained in the carton and tote.

item.title: Report X-2023110492
item.description:
Report X-2023110492

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking, odorous fiberboard box found in tote on HMPA pallet. Prior events unknown but no load area scans present on ftrack. No prior images available on spidr (checking for any diamond labels). DescribePack: Two of eighteen (three 6pks) 16oz plastic bottles lost 4oz of fluid due to defective safety seals below the cap closure. One safety seal was found completely removed and stuck to underside of cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned; tote was lined with hazbag. Ventilation utilized.
